job.title: C++ Submarine Sonar Applications Software Engineer
job.description: <p><strong>Responsibilities to Anticipate:</strong></p><ul><li>Develop robust and scalable software in C++ running Linux or UNIX operating systems on a variety of computing platforms using Agile development methods.</li><li>Design, implement, debug and problem solve Submarine Sonar Software Applications while providing feedback to other team members.</li><li>Help improve code quality by supporting software integration, verification, and code reviews.</li><li>Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas to our technology, algorithms, and products.</li><li>Work in a team environment with the product and design teams to understand end-user requirements, formulate use cases, and then translate that into a pragmatic and effective technical solution.</li><li>Dive into difficult problems and successfully deliver results on schedule along with other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications you must have:</strong></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Software Engineering, or related STEM field.</li><li>Sonar domain knowledge</li><li>Signal Processing code development</li><li>5 plus years of experience in Software Engineering to include:</li><li>Experience with C++ and Linux/UNIX and strong Object-Oriented Knowledge</li><li>The ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Security Clearance within in one year. U.S. citizenship is required as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance.</li><li>Experience developing software in a team-based development environment</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications we value:</strong></p><ul><li>Broad software development experience, including unit testing, real-time, or working in a DoD environment</li><li>Experience in Agile development methods, including Scrum, automated testing and continuous integration</li><li>Strong problem solving ability</li><li>Self-starter and ability to lead development, integration and test activities</li><li>Familiarity with the following Software Tools: Version control tools (e.g. GitHub), Jenkins, Jira, Coverity, Valgrind</li><li>Master's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or Software Engineering</li></ul>
